name: Green Chutney
history: Green Chutney, also known as 'Hari Chutney', is a staple in Indian cuisine. It is a versatile and refreshing condiment made from fresh herbs, particularly cilantro and mint, combined with spices and lemon juice.
description: Green Chutney is a vibrant and flavorful dip or sauce made primarily from cilantro and mint. It often includes ingredients like green chilies, ginger, garlic, and lemon juice for tanginess, and is seasoned with salt and spices.

instructions.title: Combine Ingredients
instructions.description: In a blender or food processor, combine cilantro, mint leaves, green chilies, ginger, garlic, lemon juice, salt, and a little water. Add sugar and cumin powder if using.

instructions.title: Blend
instructions.description: Blend the mixture until smooth. Add more water if needed to achieve the desired consistency.

instructions.title: Taste and Adjust
instructions.description: Taste the chutney and adjust the seasoning as needed. It should be a harmonious blend of spicy, tangy, and fresh flavors.

instructions.title: Serve or Store
instructions.description: Serve the chutney immediately or store it in a refrigerator for up to a week. Use it as a dip, spread, or accompaniment to various dishes.

tips: For a spicier chutney, add more green chilies.
Lemon juice not only adds tanginess but also helps in preserving the green color of the chutney.
variations: Incorporate yogurt for a creamy version of this chutney.
Experiment with adding other herbs or spices like coriander seeds or tamarind for different flavors.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
storage.instructions: Store in the refrigerator and use a clean, dry spoon for serving.

presentationTips: Serve in a small bowl or traditional chutney dish.
Garnish with a sprig of mint or a slice of lemon for added appeal.
